original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares plunge in mid day trade on earnings reports
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares drop after earnings reports disclose the aftermath of macroeconomic decisions taken and implemented to secure a 2.9 billion US dollar loan, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) plunged 2.48 percent or 222.77 points to 8,760.44, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 dropped 3.13 percent or 81.97 points to 2,535.82.
The market generated a turnover of 541 million rupees during 1200 hours.

Sri Lanka’s banks have sought clarity on a proposed domestic debt restructure questioning whether there was non-voluntary element in the plan and also called for transparent discussions with all banks.
Sri Lanka’s Central Bank and Treasury officials have said there will be voluntary debt ‘optimization’ for domestic debt holders.
Top losers during mid day trade were Vallibel One, Commercial Bank and Sampath Bank. (Colombo/May02/2023)
